result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward M. Neu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/FTS or combo, if doesn't hold status then must perform 10 hours community service per week.

Undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed by agent.
Amended: date committed 3-16-2015 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward M. Neu

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Kim
Case called: 11:24 am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/pro se.  
States recites agreement.   VRCW (no restutition requested).
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
PLEA:  Guilty
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH 1 year Probation.  Conditions: Undergo any assessement, treatment or counseling as deemed by agent, maintain FTE/FTS or combo, if you don't hold status perform 10 hrs CS per week, court costs, and no DNA sample. 
Adj:11:32 am
Plea hearing on May 29, 2015 at 11:20 am.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   No contact with victim(s): KFC-any. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
